title: Chesapeake & Ohio Canal National Historical Park: Fees & Passes
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Fees & Passes              Fees & Passes      Entrance Fees and Park Passes Please note, changes concerning existing entrance and camping fees along the C&O Canal began June 1, 2015.Entrance fees are only collected at the Great Falls Entrance Station. Over 80% of the fees collected are returned to the park for specific projects. All other access to the park is free. America the Beautiful Passes, Senior Passes, and Annual Passes may only be purchased at the Great Falls Entrance Station. More information on these and other passes can be found by visiting the National Parks and Federal Recreational Lands Pass Program. Three Day Pass $10 - per private, non-commercial vehicle (include motorcycles, passenger cars, pickup trucks, RV's and vans). $5 - per person 16 years of age or older when entering on foot or bicycle Park passes are valid for the date of purchase plus two days at the Great Falls area of the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park on the Maryland side of the Potomac River. Annual Pass$30 - Valid for one full year from the month of purchase. Permits access to Great Falls Park, Virginia and the Great Falls area of the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park on the Maryland side of the Potomac River. The annual pass allows entrance for the pass holder and additional passengers in a single private non-commercial vehicle, or pass holder plus three adults when entering on foot or bicycle. Commercial Tour $25 - 1-6 passenger capacity plus $3 per person. $40 - 7- 25 passenger capacity $100 - 26+ passenger capacity vehicle Non-profit groups (Scouts, church, clubs...)Vehicles with a passenger capacity of 16 or more persons, $3 per person age 16 and over or commercial rate whichever is cheaper. Vehicles with passenger capacity of fewer than 16 persons, $10 for the vehicle or commercial rate whichever is cheaper. The commercial pass is valid for date of purchase plus two days. Please note that fees are based on vehicle capacity and not actual occupants.      Other Park Fees Carderock Pavilion Reservations A permit is required April to October to rent the facilities. Please go to Recreation.gov for further information and reservations. For more information email Acting Fee Supervisor Shaun Lehmann e-mail us          Information on Camping Fees can be found here. Most Campsites are $20/night, Group sites are $40/night.      Mule-Drawn Canal Boat Rides at Great Falls Tavern Visitor Center require a fee. Visit the Public Boat Rides page for more information.
